img.alt: A disc pivoted at the midpoint of a vertical radius - in the vertical plane

problem.p: A uniform disc has mass \(m\) and radius \(r\). The disc is pivoted at the midpoint of a vertical radius, marked by a red line as shown. Initially, the disc is held at rest. After the disc is released, it swings downward in the vertical plane. Neglect all resistive forces.
problem.part:
What is the angular acceleration of the disc at the instant the red line is horizontal?
\(\alpha=(2g)/(3r)\)\(\alpha=g/(3r)\)\(\alpha=(2g)/(5r)\)\(\alpha=g/(4r)\)\(\alpha=(3g)/(5r)\)\(\alpha=g/(2r)\)

What is the maximum linear speed of the bottom point of the disc during the motion?
\(v_{max} = \sqrt (6gr)\)\(v_{max} = \sqrt (5gr)\)\(v_{max} = 2\sqrt (gr)\)\(v_{max} = \sqrt (3gr)\)\(v_{max} = 2\sqrt (6gr)\)\(v_{max} = 2\sqrt (3gr)\)
